Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: kim wild "mami"
Reviews.Content: More than we expected. Besides the fact it has the stupid Windows 8, it is a really fast, reliable, high quality computer. Nice HD widescreen camera, great for skype, but the microphone is not that great, people say they can't hear us that loud, but everything else seems to be just right.

Reviews.Title: fast starting
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: With the SSD a real fast start up. Light but still has a DVD player, backlit keyboard is nice too. I use the touch screen way more than I thought, but the screen needs a cleaning more often. Great powerful laptop for the price. The last star got lost because of Windows 8. Don't like the combined log in for many applications, don't want to use f***book nor a windows email, one password doesn't fit all !

Reviews.Title: Dell laptop
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Porter
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by the ease of operation after reading and hearing of so many unhappy people regarding Windows 8.  My wife is a 7 power user but I am an XP person.  It's her new computer but she has taught me how to navigate and I am seriously thinking of going this way April 6th.I am a windows phone 8 user which helped somewhat to understanding apps and swiping, but I really like no tabs and the clean UI.The computer has everything she needs.  She replaced her win 7 laptop with this one so the mouse monitor, keyboard, printer and carrying bag all were usable.  All win7 programs worked on this computer.We have only purchased Dell since 2000 and have always been happy, happy, happy!Highly recommend.UPDATEPrice went up quite a bit so I updated my Dell desktop to Vista which was already on the computer.  After some rough spots, it performs well.  I will wait for this laptop to come back down to earth price wise and reconsider moving to it again.Wife is still very happy and I occasionally use it.  Very easy to move back and forth between 8 & Vista but,  my wife wants her office to switch from 7 to 8.  She  only wants it if all monitors are also changed.  She keeps swiping at her screen at work (ha ha).  We shall see.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Deal!
Reviews.Author: Upta Camp
Reviews.Content: Initial Thoughts:-  Aluminum case is very nice, the backlit keyboards and touch screen all work together to make for a nice fit and finish. Although the screen doesn't go to the edge I prefer this for swiping in for settings and such in W8. The computer booted up very fast and all restarts were very quick, love the SSD!-  After installing all 74 automatic updates I was able to update to 8.1 for free, but I had to do the updates first.Pros:- Fit and finish great for the money.- Onboard graphics are surprisingly good, I play many games from Second Life to Steam downloaded games (Rust Alpha runs well and is brand new). The HD video playback is great.- Great audio!- Amazing multi-tasking and fluidity in screen changes. It does a lot and it does it effortlessly- All 4 USB are 3.0 vs others with 1/4- Value, Value, Value!Cons:- Battery while gaming is about 2hours, maybe 5 hours of regular internet usage. No idea where they get 7hours from and this is only a con because of their unrealistic claim. Had they said 5hours I'd be pleased. If battery life matters to you take note that THE BATTERY IS NOT  REMOVABLE!Conclusion:- I think this is a great buy. It is a very high end laptop for the money and with the SSD and touch screen you really are getting a good deal. I wish some people would review the laptop more and windows 8 less.

Reviews.Title: Love the laptop
Reviews.Author: nasser
Reviews.Content: I purchased the laptop with good expecations from Dell.  Working with the laptop, it actually exceeded my expectations.  Loved the features, and the shipping was just as good.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Michael O Smith
Reviews.Content: The computer lightning fast.  Windows 8 takes some getting used to however no complaints with the computer.  The battery doesn't last as long as advertised but none of them do.  You can't beat this laptop at this price.

Reviews.Title: Doesnt use SSD
Reviews.Author: Christian De Freitas
Reviews.Content: I can see the ssd drive, but windows itself came on the 500gb partition, doesnt make sense that having the ssd drive, the os is on the normal hdd.For all the rest its a great laptop, nice speed and screeni'm going to return this and get me a M series processor with 750gb hdd http://amzn.to/1fXsxf9

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop BUT DONT BE FOOLED NO SSD32
Reviews.Author: EDDIE R
Reviews.Content: Amazon needs to correct this FALSE advertisement - this laptop does not have a 32B SSD that is completely misleading.  Dell has what is called a HYPERDRIVE First NO  SSD 32GB - that's false you only have an 8GB cache. A good thing because it will speed up you're most visited site.  Second You will have about 450 GB of space due to he recovery and misc partitions.  The features of a lit keyboard, Bluetooth, 6GB ram, 500GB HHD and i5 cpu combo with any other brand will cost you over $725.  This laptop started at $612 now it jumped to $690.  Overall if you're looking for the combo features which for most users do find it ideal then you will win on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: not what I ordered
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Siloche
Reviews.Content: I ordered Dell 15.6" Inspiron Laptop 6GB 500GB + 32GB SSD - i15zT-4802sLV but I received Dell Inspiron 15z-5523In presenting the product on amazon.com was specified graphics card Intel HD Graphics 4400 but the laptop that I received has graphics card  Intel HD Graphics 4000.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: nitin jain
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop as i had to return Acer aspire secondary to wifi issue. There has not been any day when i have problem with wifi. I needed laptop primarily to complete my assignments, search web and watch online videos (occasional). I have no problem with this laptop since i bought this little over a month ago. I received laptop earlier then i expected. I rarely use touch screen but it is nice to have touch screen specially with windows 8. I do not have any problem with Win 8 so far as i always use it in desktop mode. i use win 8.1. I also have chrome book which so far i really like (i have it only for 1 wk so far).The only issue i have with this laptop is that it is bit heavy although i do not move/carry it as often but when i do i can feel the heaviness.Over all this is my first and good experience with dell.

Reviews.Title: Great product for this price
Reviews.Author: ISTVAN HERENYI
Reviews.Content: I chose this product to have a home laptop that I can use easily and simple.It is fast and easy. I like the W8 experience with touch screen as well. Originally I didn't want to buy a touch screen one, but this one was for a good price, but now I got addicted to the touch screen and always use it.Actually, this is the second one I ordered, the first one was for my girlfriend and she was really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great PC
Reviews.Author: jordan
Reviews.Content: windows 8 isn't as bad or difficult to use as many old fogies claim. If you use a smart phone then use can use windows 8. I rarely use the touchscreen but its nice when I need it. I use this laptop just like my old one ie mouse, typing, plus you can choose classic view and the PC is just like the old laptops. I recommend this Dell inspiron Z especially with these specs for the price of $600

Reviews.Title: good product considering the price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Valeriano
Reviews.Content: For U$547 it is an excellent deal. So for I can not complain about anything in special... good product from DELL

Reviews.Title: super
Reviews.Author: Izzetsakarya
Reviews.Content: super..very useful.Get this laptop at this price is very cheap.fast delivery. thank you very much.have a good day ,goodbye.....

Reviews.Title: An OCD Review
Reviews.Author: Nona
Reviews.Content: Overall this computer is great-ish. It runs Windows 8, which people tend to love or hate (I'm that rare 'meh' bird) which is important to consider. It doesn't come with any bells or whistles, or practical applications, and Microsoft Office is spendy so be prepared for that extra cost. As far as size, it's reasonable, and the the nice large screen is good for anyone who likes big pictures.BUT.My screen has some sort of air-bubble along the top edge of the screen. That might be the product of a minor manufacturing defect with the touchscreen, but IT'S THERE. It's not getting bigger, so that's... Good? But it also won't go away, no matter what I try!In addition, I'm not sure that it's a great investment when similarly powerful computers are getting smaller and more compact, and DO come with all the bells and whistles. If I had to do it all again, I might opt for the FAR less expensive ASUS Transformer tablet (which comes pre-loaded with MS Office), and that will definitely be my option for the kids school computers.

Reviews.Title: Really good buy
Reviews.Author: Aravind Rajagopal
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop in January and the price was $600 then. For that price it is a real bargain. It is fast, easy to use and a good sensitive touch screen. i was nervous about using Windows 8 but it hasn't really been a problem. The only real issue I have with this laptop is the battery. The battery barely lasts 3 hours when i watch movies and stuff. Overall, I would be happy to recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great working laptop
Reviews.Author: LIONEL W CAVE
Reviews.Content: The excellent rating given, is for the very awesome way the laptop was delivered, the great way in which I was able to start work almost instantly out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop I've Ever Bought!
Reviews.Author: Morgan Evans
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this laptop to anyone! This laptop is light, thin, touchscreen, disc drive, solid state, Win8, etc. This laptop packs a powerful punch and has easily handled any program or game I've tossed at it. It can easily run intense programs such as CAD programs or Autodesk Maya, and can run games like Diablo 3 and League of Legends perfectly fine! Only downside is that the disc drive is not bluray, but oh well! This laptop is WELL worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Its really nice laptop to buy
Reviews.Author: Sunil Kumar Jha
Reviews.Content: Only one thing I am missing is the Num pad in the keyboard for faster data entry. Must go for it

Reviews.Title: Good Computer
Reviews.Author: Donald Haney
Reviews.Content: Overall very good computer.  Boots up quickly and generally is fast to use.  I was disappointed that their was no numeric keypad on right of keyboard; I thought there was a numeric keypad when I ordered.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: Great loptop, i love it. The touch screen its great, it was acually a gift but that person is like it o lot!

Reviews.Title: Had it not even a month hard drive went out
Reviews.Author: Linda S Robbins
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop at the end of Feb and the hard drive went out 4 days ago. Right now it is sitting in Houston, TX at Dell's Repair depot. I bought the laptop on the sole purpose for the ssd drive and the fact that it was faster and better for my line of work. Not happy at all about this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent computer with DVD player!
Reviews.Author: LISA S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent computer, easy to navigate through windows.  Back lit keyboard is an awesome feature, great sound speakers.  Boots up quickly.  Able to run mtiple tabs at once.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: aaron cheek
Reviews.Content: Having the choice between using the mouse or touch screen is a wonderfull feature. Windows 8 is not to hard to get use to and the screen has great resolution

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Nidhin PS
Reviews.Content: I love it, but battery never give the back up as mentioned (7 hour)......... i recommend it to all... not high end

Reviews.Title: Heavier than I wanted, but nice unit.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the touchscreen.  I like the backlit keyboard.  I don't like that the viewing angle on the screen is so small - 10% off center up and down, and the picture quality suffers.  But, they're pretty much all like that.  The price is great for a unit like this; it's got ALL the faetures you want - SSD, touchscreen, backlit keyboard, i5 processor.  But I don't know how the can call this "ultra", as in ultra light?  No.  I have a several-year old Toshiba - plastic and thicker - that weighs less.  But it's not touchscreen.I'm debating sending this back for a smaller and lighter unit, but... I probably won't find one for this price.  I like having the big screen, but I hate having the weight for something I intend to carry around now.  I just keep glancing over at my other light 15.6" screen, non-touch, laptop and thinking... hmmmm.... do I really NEED this new ultrabook?  But... I'll probaby keep it.  It IS a nice unit, overall.

Reviews.Title: Ok so far
Reviews.Author: Tac Phun
Reviews.Content: Ok so far, should already have Microsoft office word and excel as a standard on the laptop. A little hard to navigate should have the classic start button
